
### methods in Rust (1)  {.smaller}


```rust
pub struct Rectangle {
    width: u32,
    height: u32
}

impl Rectangle {
    fn area(&self) -> u32 {
        self.width * self.height
    }

    fn multiply_size(&mut self, amount: u32) {
        self.width *= amount;
        self.height *= amount;
    }
}

fn foo(rect: &mut Rectangle) {
    let size = rect.area();
    rect.multiply_size(4);
}

```


### traits (1a)  {.smaller}


```rust
import std::cmp::PartialEq;
import std::cmp::Eq;

pub struct Rectangle {
    width: u32,
    height: u32
}

impl PartialEq for Rectangle {
    fn eq(&self, other: &Rectangle) -> bool {
        self.width == other.width &&
        self.height == other.height
    }
}

impl Eq for Rectangle {}
```

### traits (1b)  {.smaller}

```rust
impl PartialEq for Rectangle {
    fn eq(&self, other: &Rectangle) -> bool { ... }
}
```
<hr/>
can write function that uses that impl:
```rust
fn print_if_equal1(x: Rectangle, y: Rectangle) {
    if x.eq(&y) { println!("EQUAL"); }
}

// special rule: == calls PartialEq::eq
fn print_if_equal2(x: Rectangle, y: Rectangle) {
    if x == y { println!("EQUAL"); }
}
```
<hr/>
or that works for anything with `impl PartialEq`:
```rust
fn print_if_equal_generic<T: PartialEq>(x: T, y: T) {
    if x == y { println!("EQUAL"); }
}
```

trait ShapeOps {
    fn draw(&self, canvas: &mut Canvas);
}

fn drawCentered<T: ShapeOps>(shape: &T, canvas: &mut Canvas) {
    canvas.moveToCenter();
    shape.draw(canvas);
}
